caption: Van Krevelen diagram showing H/C vs O/C for all detected compounds
description: Van Krevelen diagrams are figures used to visualize FTICR-MS detected peaks based on their Oxygen to Carbon (O:C) and Hydrogen to Carbon (H:C) ratios. Plot is colored based on NA, and faceted by site.
insights: The position of the masses in the van Krevelen diagram can be used to group detected compounds into broad molecular classes. The plot shows: For group "AL": 746 masses as Amino sugar, 690 masses as Carbohydrate, 3335 masses as Cond. HC, 9533 masses as Lignin, 2320 masses as Lipid, 364 masses as Other, 3216 masses as Protein, 1609 masses as Tannin, 569 masses as Unsat. HC. HC, 9932 masses as Lignin, 2541 masses as Lipid, 406 masses as Other, 3414 masses as Protein, 1669 masses as Tannin, 611 masses as Unsat. HC. For group "KI": 809 masses as Amino sugar, 736 masses as Carbohydrate, 3639 masses as Cond. HC, 10235 masses as Lignin, 2569 masses as Lipid, 427 masses as Other, 3462 masses as Protein, 1681 masses as Tannin, 623 masses as Unsat. HC. For group "MI": 805 masses as Amino sugar, 772 masses as Carbohydrate, 3552 masses as Cond. HC, 9764 masses as Lignin, 2497 masses as Lipid, 431 masses as Other, 3373 masses as Protein, 1698 masses as Tannin, 607 masses as Unsat. HC. For group "NO": 828 masses as Amino sugar, 803 masses as Carbohydrate, 3651 masses as Cond. HC, 10030 masses as Lignin, 2555 masses as Lipid, 434 masses as Other, 3420 masses as Protein, 1687 masses as Tannin, 623 masses as Unsat. HC. For group "PO": 740 masses as Amino sugar, 662 masses as Carbohydrate, 3123 masses as Cond. HC, 9520 masses as Lignin, 2399 masses as Lipid, 349 masses as Other, 3341 masses as Protein, 1466 masses as Tannin, 518 masses as Unsat. HC. Plot is colored based on the GFE of each peak. GFE ranges from -25.2 to 151.5. Gibbs Free Energy (GFE) reflects thermodynamic stability and bioavailability. Lower GFE values indicate more reduced, energy-rich compounds (e.g., lipids), while higher values suggest oxidized, recalcitrant materials
